definitions.definition: if a decision or an opinion is unanimous, it is agreed or shared by everyone in a group

examples.text: Unanimous agreement must be reached for this plan to go ahead.
The jury reached a unanimous verdict of ‘not guilty’.
She was the unanimous choice of the selection committee.

definitions.definition: if a group of people are unanimous, they all agree about something

examples.text: Local people are unanimous in their opposition to the proposed new road.
The committee were unanimous in rejecting the proposal.
They were unanimous in this decision.
The experts are not unanimous on this point.

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from Latin unanimus (from unus ‘one’ + animus ‘mind’) + -ous.
